resources.string: The mother city is home to various tourist attractions and South Africa\'s most popular holiday destination. Table Mountain, Lion\'s Head, and Cape Point offers hiking, paragliding, cable cart rides, and spectacular views over the city. It\'s sandy beaches attracts many a kite surfer, to enjoy the fresh air whilst floating across the long stretch of white sand dunes.

The Zulu kingdom have the warmest beaches in SA. It also have the world\'s only stadium swing, and is home to the greater range of the Drakensberg. Durban also offers the best waves for surfers. It also have the best snorkeling spots. If you feel adventurous you can cage dive with the sharks.
This mountain range stretches through the majority of South Africa. It is covered in snow during winter and stands tall over the escarpment.

The Blyde River Canyon is the world\'s largest canyon, only to The Grand Canyon in USA and Fish River Canyon in Namibia. Blyde River Canyon is part of the Panorama route, which include attractions such as God's Window, Potholes, and Sabie Falls, as well as the Mpumalanga highlands.
Stay near all attractions, and visit any of the food outlets, bars, or the entertainment arena. Start every day with a boat trip around Africa\'s oldest harbour still in operation.
The 123 hectares area has been developed for mixed-use, with both residential and commercial real estate, and attracts more than 23 million visitors a year
Spoil yourself, your family and your pet to a relaxing stay in Chapmain\'s Peak.
Take a break from the city live and enjoy the ocean. The friendly locals will make yu feel at home.

Tasting biltong and droewors is a must when visiting South Africa. It\'s air dried meat and wors (sausage) respectively. Every maker uses his/her own recipe, but the results are often similar. Nowadays you get different flavours, yet the meat of choice remains the same.
The West Coast and Cape Town provide dried fish to snack on anywhere. The taste is not for everyone thou.

Similar to the American BBQ. The preferred method is to braai on a wood fire, or charcoal. Gas braai being the least preferred, due to its lack of taste and setting a mood. We braai meat, wors (sausage) veggies, as separate entities or a combo we call "potjiekos".
This sweet treat may often be too sweet to some, yet irresistible to others.
If you are looking for something more adventurous, take a dive with the Great Whites.
Watch dolphins or play with penguins
From watching dolphins to playing with penguins, the cape have everything in store for you.
The SouthEaster as the wind in Cape Town is known, is perfect for kite surfing. For those who surf the waves, we recommend heading down to Durban as it have better waves for surfers.
Take a hike up Lion\'s Head, or a cable cart up Table Mountain, or glide off either with a paragliding. Or take a drive to one of the many airstrips that offers sky diving lessons. It\'s great fun.

For the history buffs, take a trip to where political prisoners of the Apartheid era got locked up. Here you will get to experience how prisoners felt being able to see Cape Town yet have no means of getting to it. You may even visit Madiba\'s cell of 27 years. It is untouched since his release.

Cape Town is known for it\'s world class wines and visiting one or more of the wineries of the Cape Winelands is a must. Due to its popularity it is advised to make a booking before hand to avoid disappointment. If you are a collector, make sure to bring your check book as you will surely find thr wine worth purchasing.
No trip to SA is completed without a wildlife safari in Mpumalanga/limpopo or a visit to the Kalahari.

Long Street comes alive at night, when old and young meet to paint the town red. If you are not one for the night life, you may enjoy a night out in one of the many restaurants any time during the day.
